title: How is 40 ping West coast and 90-130 ping East Coast for one server Balanced

embed.description: I believe that people should be accountable for their words. I also believe that paying customers should be at the very least, respected. Riot has has recognized East coast latency as unfair, sectioning the competitive University league into regions, and agreeing to fly contestants to the west coas

body:
I don't understand why Riot cannot just give the East Coasters of NA a server. What downside would there be. Sure it sorta cuts into your profits but seriously if there was a East Coast server more East Coast People would, more than likely, play the game and buying RP from you to buy champs and so fourth. You keep on saying, "We are working on it." or "This is something under our radar." There hasn't even been a Riot update since the new forums came out! Why do you leave The EAST COAST in the dark. You could make so much more profits if you put a East Coast Server out. EU has two servers and and they are smaller than just the US. When there are also players in Canada. So Riot, I would love to get an actual response on this topic or a possible ETA of a East Coast Server or NA relocation date.

Also I feel this link shows just how bad it is at times for us east coast players.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Cmfy4nrEWmA

replies.body:
Cause obviously riot does not have the resources like those of who made runescape.
/joke

Dude they are working on getting their own dedicated network just for League 

Just be patient

> [{quoted}](name=CynicalGiant,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bJyaOGqB,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-01-20T22:45:19.797+0000)
>
> Dude they are working on getting their own dedicated network just for League 
> 
> Just be patient

you most certainly are a west coaster. let me ask you this.. what would happen if you saw nightblue with 10 ping die and blame it on lag when you are constantly on 120 ping. how would that make you feel? how would you feel knowing nightshit3 has an advantage over you although hes secretly an average plat player, but because of riots ignorance, gets to play with perfect ping and be more reactive?

> [{quoted}](name=Maximum Lee Sin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bJyaOGqB,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2015-01-20T23:01:37.285+0000)
>
> you most certainly are a west coaster. let me ask you this.. what would happen if you saw nightblue with 10 ping die and blame it on lag when you are constantly on 120 ping. how would that make you feel? how would you feel knowing nightshit3 has an advantage over you although hes secretly an average plat player, but because of riots ignorance, gets to play with perfect ping and be more reactive?

Im supposed to care when people complain about things?

> [{quoted}](name=CynicalGiant,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bJyaOGqB,comment-id=000100010000,timestamp=2015-01-20T23:04:02.092+0000)
>
> Im supposed to care when people complain about things?

then dont act like you do. you came on the thread spreading false bullshit assuming itll help the op.

there's nothing false ... Riot really IS building out their own private network and making agreements with ISPs to speed up traffic via optimized routes.  He's asking OP to be patient because well ... they actually ARE working on it.

http://venturebeat.com/2015/01/06/dedicated-league-of-legends-network/
http://www.polygon.com/2015/1/7/7507299/riot-games-league-of-legends-lag-network

or google some other references.

> [{quoted}](name=Grand Eleven,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bJyaOGqB,comment-id=00010001000000000001,timestamp=2015-01-21T02:19:10.765+0000)
>
> there's nothing false ... Riot really IS building out their own private network and making agreements with ISPs to speed up traffic via optimized routes.  He's asking OP to be patient because well ... they actually ARE working on it.
> 
> http://venturebeat.com/2015/01/06/dedicated-league-of-legends-network/
> http://www.polygon.com/2015/1/7/7507299/riot-games-league-of-legends-lag-network
> 
> or google some other references.

You have to ask though, why are they doing this instead of just CREATING A NA EAST SERVER?

Because when you create separate servers you increase queue times.  Also, the best players of NA will be split up and won't be playing against each other.  

Frankly, I would prefer the dedicated network.  It will solve the ping problems just the same without breaking up the player base.  

I am in the midwest/east coast and i feel the ping -- anywhere between 80 and 120 with ping spikes between 400 and 1000.  Lag sucks.  Variable lag is the worst.  When you are having a day with 200 ping, it is annoying but you can memorize the delay to time your clicks to last hit.  But when your ping jumps between 100 and 600 it is so profoundly difficult to last hit.

Because they understand the complications of geographically dispersed networking better than you do.

Either A:  they are turning NA into two regions with independent ladders, ranks, and all the other goodies that go with it and thus effectively doubling the NA support overhead.

Or B:  reconfiguring the entire game codebase/infrastructure to handle geographically dispersed resource ... which is a herculean task by any measure (we're talking about a system that needs to sync transactions in seconds in order to feel satisfying while keeping players updated in milliseconds... and then put a continent between the said systems).
They did it for EU

Europe is also different countries, not just 1
I am in the Southeast so at best my ping is ever 88, but averages ~100-110; however I do have friends on the west coast and it would really bum me out that I'd not be able to play with them, but I would like to point out if you're okay being on a different server, in the Southeast I know I can get on LAN server and have sub-30 ping.

> [{quoted}](name=Anunu,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bJyaOGqB,comment-id=000100010000000000010000,timestamp=2015-01-21T15:05:19.516+0000)
>
> You have to ask though, why are they doing this instead of just CREATING A NA EAST SERVER?

Because EUNE was a complete disaster.  Took them years to recover -- most players still wanted to play on EUW, server got overloaded, then they had to scramble to put together an EUW megaserver in Amsterdam that took years to get right.

> [{quoted}](name=SmokingPuffin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bJyaOGqB,comment-id=0001000100000000000100000002,timestamp=2015-01-22T17:42:44.731+0000)
>
> Because EUNE was a complete disaster.  Took them years to recover -- most players still wanted to play on EUW, server got overloaded, then they had to scramble to put together an EUW megaserver in Amsterdam that took years to get right.

That's understandable, the majority of EU gamers come from the west just like the majority of NA gamers are from the east, what I think they are trying to avoid is emptying the west, nonetheless friendships should still keep the west populated.

> [{quoted}](name=SmokingPuffin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bJyaOGqB,comment-id=0001000100000000000100000002,timestamp=2015-01-22T17:42:44.731+0000)
>
> Because EUNE was a complete disaster.  Took them years to recover -- most players still wanted to play on EUW, server got overloaded, then they had to scramble to put together an EUW megaserver in Amsterdam that took years to get right.

EUNE was created because of language, it was even in the same location as EUW servers. Of course doing stuff like this will step on people's toes. Since being an improvement wasn't physical, such as a lower ping, it was just a negative start. EUNE still exists with it's own ladder...

Here's the thing: I know people who live next door to Riot who have worse ping than I do (I'm in Boston) -- I'm at between 80 and 100, depending on my ISP's mood.

Riot's already given a detailed explanation of what they're doing -- building their own network -- and, ***more importantly, has said that they're going to move to a central server after this network is complete.***

> [{quoted}](name=Hyrum Graff,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bJyaOGqB,comment-id=000100010001,timestamp=2015-01-21T16:33:44.733+0000)
>
> Here's the thing: I know people who live next door to Riot who have worse ping than I do (I'm in Boston) -- I'm at between 80 and 100, depending on my ISP's mood.
> 
> Riot's already given a detailed explanation of what they're doing -- building their own network -- and, ***more importantly, has said that they're going to move to a central server after this network is complete.***

This will be one of those "I'll believe it when I see it" goals. Moving to a central location is the logical thing to do. But to say it would interfere with some of Riot's other projects is an understatement. Particularly LCS, as the pros claim even 50 ping is unplayable. It the servers were moved to a central location, the pros would likely see their ping rise to the 60's. Something tells me that won't be satisfactory and LCS is one of Riot's biggest priorities.
They also claimed they were moving it to a centralized location, witch was Oregon. Centralizing it for the west coast.
That was a server *upgrade,* aimed at making the servers crash less, not at changing ping. It also happened to be in a slightly different location.

> [{quoted}](name=Maximum Lee Sin,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bJyaOGqB,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2015-01-20T23:01:37.285+0000)
>
> you most certainly are a west coaster. let me ask you this.. what would happen if you saw nightblue with 10 ping die and blame it on lag when you are constantly on 120 ping. how would that make you feel? how would you feel knowing nightshit3 has an advantage over you although hes secretly an average plat player, but because of riots ignorance, gets to play with perfect ping and be more reactive?

What I think is funny is that there are east coast challenger players yet you all still complain. I live in the middle of the us and average 70 ping. When I go to California to visit family I rarely see a difference because I get used to it so quick.

> [{quoted}](name=Zyconz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bJyaOGqB,comment-id=000100010003,timestamp=2015-01-21T17:33:45.054+0000)
>
> What I think is funny is that there are east coast challenger players yet you all still complain. I live in the middle of the us and average 70 ping. When I go to California to visit family I rarely see a difference because I get used to it so quick.

70 ping is a lot different from 100 ping. Trust me in a game like league where the seconds matter it's an unfair advantage.

> [{quoted}](name=CynicalGiant,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bJyaOGqB,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-01-20T22:45:19.797+0000)
>
> Dude they are working on getting their own dedicated network just for League 
> 
> Just be patient

Which won't fix the ping problem. A lot of the player base is already on the new network and haven't noticed.

No the new player base is not on the new network, the new network won't even be in the testing stages until March, The problem with peoples pings right now is lost packets and taking longer routes to the servers, Yes we won't get ping at 20 on the east coast, but just like there whole network plan, they have to do this phase first, after they will move the servers to a central location.

> [{quoted}](name=Silents429,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bJyaOGqB,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2015-01-21T00:06:14.125+0000)
>
> No the new player base is not on the new network, the new network won't even be in the testing stages until March, The problem with peoples pings right now is lost packets and taking longer routes to the servers, Yes we won't get ping at 20 on the east coast, but just like there whole network plan, they have to do this phase first, after they will move the servers to a central location.

No.

The network is online and functioning in several major cities. Stop spreading false rumors. With the launch of Chicago a lot of ISPs in the central region are already routing traffic directly to the Riot network. Including Comcast, Charter, Cogent, and Zayo.

Source? 
Because I have.

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/AMupzBHw-na-server-roadmap-update-optimizing-the-internet-for-league-and-you

http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support/WH8doH76-na-servers-and-the-future

And re-reading these, they only said they are still in the process of making deals with ISP's. And no one is actually using the new network, because get this, it doesn't exist yet.

Riot Ahab In one of the comments says "The full network is slated to be built by the end of March this year."

And for the ISPs

"The hardware will be functional -- the agreements may take a little extra time (since contracts always do), and there will be extra work hammering out individual hiccups and making sure as many players as possible have their connections pathing correctly to this network."

"It can take us many months to work with large ISP companies to achieve even modest results. Gaming is currently not a priority for most. However we are investing a lot of time in educating the ISPs that have LoL players as customers. It is very company dependent and we expect it will be a long road to travel but ultimately great for gamers." -RIOT SONICDEATHMONK


Now go one and list your source, that has Riot employees stating I am wrong in any of this, Otherwise your the one spreading false information.

Source? Sure.

http://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/2rg8m3/na_server_roadmap_update_optimizing_the_internet/cnfloi9

Now how about a traceroute that actually shows what is actually happening?

From a public looking glass:

Tracing route to 192.64.171.1 via IPv4 from Chicago...

traceroute to 192.64.171.1 (192.64.171.1), 30 hops max, 60 byte packets
 1  vl11.dist01.chi02.steadfast.net (208.100.4.50)  0.363 ms  0.430 ms  0.478 ms
 2  xe-0-0-1.core4.chi02.steadfast.net (208.100.32.54)  0.227 ms  0.243 ms  0.244 ms
 3  eqix-ch2.riotgamesdirect.com (206.223.119.235)  0.322 ms  0.329 ms  0.337 ms
 4  104.160.131.44 (104.160.131.44)  0.332 ms  0.962 ms  0.334 ms
 5  104.160.159.11 (104.160.159.11)  48.432 ms  48.435 ms  48.477 ms
 6  104.160.159.2 (104.160.159.2)  45.082 ms  45.139 ms  45.130 ms
 7  104.160.128.101 (104.160.128.101)  46.119 ms  46.140 ms  46.134 ms
 8  * * *
 9  * * *
10  * * *

http://old.steadfast.net/corporate/lookingglass.php

As you can see from the Traceroute, the network is clearly online and functioning. Many players in the central region on Comcast and Charter can already run a traceroute and see this for themselves.
I like conflicting information from them, Both posts being 15 days old.

> [{quoted}](name=Silents429,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bJyaOGqB,comment-id=0001000000000000000100000000,timestamp=2015-01-21T21:17:17.924+0000)
>
> I like conflicting information from them, Both posts being 15 days old.

What are you referencing? So far they've basically said the same thing the whole time.

A riot comment on his says some they have a few ISPs on board, while comments in that SAME post say otherwise, and they say otherwise on my links. On both links they point out we won't be seeing anything until March, and that these deals with the ISPs will take time. 

I feel like either they aren't good at conveying information properly or someones misreading this.
same lagging issued happened to me 200 + ping can not play 400+ ping now all the time...
200 ping?  That's cute.  Try 600+ for multiple consecutive seconds, several times per game.
I'm not on the west coast but close, and i am currently sitting around 100+ so Idk how some on the west coast are doing better.

dont even think im mad at the high ping, or wasnt at first.... I moved to Georgia (i know first mistake) and when i first got here i had a 69-78 ping. 3 yrs down the road and went from a 20mbs connection to a 120mbs (same provider) i am constantly higher than 115 ping now.... i understand that west coast is where there hub is or main stage is w/e u want to call it. but the fact that is getting worse is stupid. Not sure if its due to more players playing overe here or wat... but i would really like to see some change for the east coast. maybe expand bigger and go NA west and NA east as far as leagues are in the LCS. IDK please fix though.. i am tired of playing at a huge disadvantage to west coast players playing at 10-30 ping =(

> [{quoted}](name=Knig,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bJyaOGqB,comment-id=0029,timestamp=2015-06-17T16:17:08.366+0000)
>
> dont even think im mad at the high ping, or wasnt at first.... I moved to Georgia (i know first mistake) and when i first got here i had a 69-78 ping. 3 yrs down the road and went from a 20mbs connection to a 120mbs (same provider) i am constantly higher than 115 ping now.... i understand that west coast is where there hub is or main stage is w/e u want to call it. but the fact that is getting worse is stupid. Not sure if its due to more players playing overe here or wat... but i would really like to see some change for the east coast. maybe expand bigger and go NA west and NA east as far as leagues are in the LCS. IDK please fix though.. i am tired of playing at a huge disadvantage to west coast players playing at 10-30 ping =(

When you moved the servers were still located in CA. A non-ideal place, but probably the best of any on the West Coast. A while back they moved to Portland. An absolutely terrible location. Reason being that most major internet backbones don't have a direct route to Portland. And the route it does take is much, much longer for the majority of the people in the US/Canada. Especially from Georgia.

> [{quoted}](name=Penguin Eclipse,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bJyaOGqB,comment-id=00290000,timestamp=2015-06-17T16:38:14.900+0000)
>
> When you moved the servers were still located in CA. A non-ideal place, but probably the best of any on the West Coast. A while back they moved to Portland. An absolutely terrible location. Reason being that most major internet backbones don't have a direct route to Portland. And the route it does take is much, much longer for the majority of the people in the US/Canada. Especially from Georgia.

thank you, i did not know that. explains alot but still would like to see some new servers. i understand it takes money but for the "biggest computer game in the world" you would think that they could afford and profit from them.

LAN 15ms ping, NA 94ms ping. What country am I living in? (Hypothetical)

Playing on Latin America North is much better ping but I don't understand anyone and cant read anything.

The perfect time to talk about this.

Happy placements errbody.
If they don't want to separate the servers and don't want to create an East  coast server then the only real {{champion:254}} able option would be a central server.

A central server would be nice.
ooh, and lets throw in dedicated hardware for the project.
and you know... Hell with it. Why not just make a dedicated nation-wide network for everyone to connect to. Just for kicks.

. . . Oh dear. It seems this is already in the pipes. XD

The hard part about this is... Hawaii.
If they move the west coast servers central, people playing in Hawaii will have even worse ping than they already do(right now Hawaii ping is just as bad as east coast ping). 
If they make an east coast server, Hawaii will be unaffected. 
If they move the servers central, Hawaii could be in the 180-200 ping(or more, idk) range instead of 90-130ish that they are getting right now. That would be extremely rude to all the players in Hawaii.
tbh it's not just the east coast, I live in Arkansas and every one of my friends and I run an average of a 108 ping. It's ridiculous.
I'm in Southern CA, and my ping is average 150-250 now. Not all west coast players have amazing ping either.

It's not about ping, its about PACKET LOSS.  A lot of East Coast players can play EUW w/ 120-130ms ping w/ out packet loss.  MS= miliseconds, ei.. 1000th of a second.  130ms is about as fast as you can blink. SO quit whining about ping, and look at the real issue Packet Loss aka lag/freeze frames.  Go play EUW, seriously I can play all day w/ no LAG aka Packet Loss.  NA on the other hand I can't go 2 games w/ out some type of Lagg.  BTW I live in OH.

> [{quoted}](name=DericDraco,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bJyaOGqB,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-01-20T23:42:03.072+0000)
>
> It's not about ping, its about PACKET LOSS.  A lot of East Coast players can play EUW w/ 120-130ms ping w/ out packet loss.  MS= miliseconds, ei.. 1000th of a second.  130ms is about as fast as you can blink. SO quit whining about ping, and look at the real issue Packet Loss aka lag/freeze frames.  Go play EUW, seriously I can play all day w/ no LAG aka Packet Loss.  NA on the other hand I can't go 2 games w/ out some type of Lagg.  BTW I live in OH.

Packet loss is a big problem. But for ISPs with a quality network it is a non-issue.

A ping of 120-130 is very noticeable and completely unavoidable for even the best ISPs if they are on the East Coast. It is playable, but it is definitely a disadvantage compared to someone under 60ms ping.

> [{quoted}](name=DericDraco,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bJyaOGqB,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-01-20T23:42:03.072+0000)
>
> It's not about ping, its about PACKET LOSS.  A lot of East Coast players can play EUW w/ 120-130ms ping w/ out packet loss.  MS= miliseconds, ei.. 1000th of a second.  130ms is about as fast as you can blink. SO quit whining about ping, and look at the real issue Packet Loss aka lag/freeze frames.  Go play EUW, seriously I can play all day w/ no LAG aka Packet Loss.  NA on the other hand I can't go 2 games w/ out some type of Lagg.  BTW I live in OH.

This may be so but if you look in perspective, if you are fighting a person that has the same skill level but they live on the West Coast, They WILL win not because they are better than you. But because they have 40-50 ping and you have 90-130 ping as well as packet loss since they are closer to the server and their information gets processed first.

Lets be realistic though.
How often, outside of challenger, do you encounter someone who is 100% equal skill?
Never mind other lane dynamics (like ganks).

Latency does create an advantage. But I'd argue (and have for a long time now), that the difference is minimal at best for the vast majority of players. Because short of outlying cases (500 ping spike or some such rot), skill trumps latency.

But a lot of people seem to think latency is the only thing keeping them out of masters. So I'll probably get down-voted into oblivion again.
Riot lives in CA so they do not care about this issue. If they do care.. why does it take a nine figure company so long to address? its because there is WASTE.

Because they're focusing their efforts on a more long-term solution that involves setting up a dedicated nation-wide network.

Duct tape may be able to fix anything. but it's not always the best solution.
But it doesn't fix the issue that players not in California are still to far away from the servers. And last time they "centralized it" they moved them to Oregon.

When did they "centralize" it?
Last I heard (read), they upgraded their hardware and moved into a new building. That's not really centralizing.

> [{quoted}](name=Ariel the Cruel,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=bJyaOGqB,comment-id=000d000000000000,timestamp=2015-01-21T19:49:14.330+0000)
>
> When did they "centralize" it?
> Last I heard (read), they upgraded their hardware and moved into a new building. That's not really centralizing.
